meanings.sent1: She feminises her outfit with a pink scarf.
meanings.sent2: The dress feminises her figure beautifully.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to feminise his voice for the play was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The soft music feminises the atmosphere of the room.
meanings.sent5: The gentle breeze feminises the garden, making it feel like a peaceful oasis.

meanings.definition: To give a feminine quality or character to.
meanings.sent1: Adding flowers to the room feminises the decor.
meanings.sent2: Her smile feminises her face, making her look more approachable.
meanings.sent3: The tough guy trying to feminise his walk was quite a sight to see.
meanings.sent4: The pink paint feminises the walls, creating a warm and inviting space.
meanings.sent5: The delicate lace feminises the dress, giving it an elegant touch.

meanings.definition: To cause to adopt feminine characteristics or qualities.
meanings.sent1: The book feminises the main character, making her relatable to many readers.
meanings.sent2: The mentor feminises her protege, helping her embrace her strengths.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to feminise his cooking skills led to some interesting results.
meanings.sent4: The new hairstyle feminises her look, boosting her confidence.
meanings.sent5: The gentle guidance feminises his leadership style, creating a supportive environment.
